title: Understanding Habituation
text: Habituation is a psychological process where repeated exposure to a stimulus results in a decrease in response. In the context of substance use, it refers to getting used to the effects of a substance.

hintAnswer: the process of getting used to doing something—such as using a substance—and then not wanting to stop
title: Identifying Habituation
text: Which of the following best describes habituation?
choices: a disturbance in behavior or mental function during or after the consumption of a substance
the process of getting used to doing something—such as using a substance—and then not wanting to stop
when the lack of the substance causes physical symptoms
the emotional developments and changes that accompany substance misuse
